abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is unlikely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; and both
            Bank and Borrower performances are satisfactory. Among the
            lessons cited were these: 1) A Competitive Grants system is
            feasible even within a small scientific community such as
            the agricultural research community in Ecuador, if adequate
            resources are dedicated to project preparation and
            monitoring of activities. This requires a much greater
            amount of resources than conventional supply driven research
            projects. 2) A Competitive Grants system can make a
            significant contribution to strengthening the national
            capacity to do agricultural research by drawing out latent
            capacity external to the national agricultural research
            system as well as leveraging resources which might otherwise
            not be used for agricultural research. Because most
            counterpart resources are available in kind (personnel,
            facilities etc.) the external financial contribution is
            essential as leverage to initiate the process. 3) A
            Competitive Grants system is an important tool to help
            researchers and institutions to prepare high quality
            proposals and install good financial and reporting systems.
            Traditional national research authorities derive
            considerable benefit from the experience of participating in
            competitive grant schemes. 4) A Competitive Grants system is
            flexible enough to allow funding of research in all aspects
            of the production chain if needed. In this project the
            following areas were covered; natural resource management,
            production, agro-industry, marketing and occupational health
            of field workers. 5) As a Competitive Grants system per se
            is not self-sustaining, means for establishing a
            competitive, demand driven system beyond the project phase
            need to be developed as an integral part of the project
            itself. While a Competitive Grants system is very effective
            for the many reasons listed above, they are not sustainable
            unless there is full government support for a larger
            agricultural innovation system. Competitive Grants should be
            seen as one mechanism to promote innovation within a broader
            scheme of financing. 6) Serious reform of an established
            national research establishment requires a combination of
            political will and staff support.
